TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SessionSecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs extends System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs

remarks.format:
## Remarks By default, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.SessionSecurityTokenReceived> event is raised from within the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.OnAuthenticateRequest%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method after a session token (<xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken>) has been successfully read from the session cookie. In the event handler, you can modify properties of the session token before it is passed further along the pipeline and is used to authenticate the entity making the request (user).
You can access the token through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.SessionToken%2A> property. After modifying the token, you can ensure that it is written back to the cookie by setting the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.ReissueCookie%2A> to `true`. Finally, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionAuthenticationModule.SessionSecurityTokenReceived> event is a cancelable event, and you can set the <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs.Cancel%2A> property (inherited from <xref:System.ComponentModel.CancelEventArgs>) to abort further processing of the request.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SessionSecurityToken sessionToken) cil managed

Docs.param: The session security token that was received.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that has the specified session token.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.SessionToken%2A> property is set to the token specified by the `sessionToken` parameter. The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SessionSecurityTokenReceivedEventArgs.ReissueCookie%2A> property is initialized to `false`.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to reissue the session cookie with the response.
Docs.value: to reissue the session cookie with the response; otherwise, . The default is , the session cookie is not reissued with the response.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the session security token that was received.
Docs.value: The session token that was received.
